div.p:
On recollecting your
kind notice that I might
draw some money
from the testimonial
fund through you
and having nothing
else at present in
my power unless
I should begin to
draw afresh from
the L. Mission Society
or from Mr Murray
the publisher, I shall
feel much obliged
if you can let me
have £50 of the money
in your hands without
making it much
known. If it should
be necessary to discuss
the thing before
committees you
need not take the
trouble, but return
the receipt by Mrs L.

I might apply to the
London Missionary
society but it would
be beginning the
£100 for 1857 which
I have no intention
of doing. I have
nothing now there
as they gave part of
my salary to Mrs L.
when I was absent
and the sum (£100)
I had over of my
four years trip is
now among the things
that were
this £50 if it can be
got without trouble
and talk, will enable
us to go on till we
get more into our
hands either from
the book or testimonial.

I am busy at work
never out scarcely,
am going to the Arch bishop's
tonight and as I am
not sure about the
"stone" & "ston" I imitate
him & sign myself
